item.title: 'Juice' Bar:
item.content:encoded: So the winged cat, red-haired girl’s armor, arms on fire, keys, etc. are all "Fairy Tail" references, yes?

item.title: Hero's Quest:
item.content:encoded: Are we sure that completing a Monument mission before you have enough Unfinished Compositions for that monument gives you the boost to item find chance? Because I tried that with the eighth and it didn't seem to work.

item.title: Book of the Twilight:
item.content:encoded: Because .hack is still a better love story than "Twilight."

item.title: Petventures: Preliminary InfoDump
item.content:encoded:
You send your pets on an adventure, and they come back with shinies.

Known Adventure Locations:
Training Area :: Ramen Shop
Training Area :: Training Grounds
Training Area :: Genin Schoolyard
Training Area :: Storage Room

Known Adventure Pals (Unknown if stat bonuses are unique per account):
Roger (Bopping +1, Speedy +1, Fancy +2, Eleven +1)
Baby (Nomming +3, Sniffing +2)
Catasha (Shenanigans +2, Nomming +2, Stealth +1)
Nosebleed (Speedy +3, Fancy +2)
Carlito (Nomming +1, Flops +2, Strongness +2)
Rudy (Bopping +2, Strongness +2, Fancy +1)
Smokey (Strongness +2, Stealth +2, Sniffing +1)
Ridley (Sniffing +1, Eleven +11)

Known Optional Bonuses:
Extra Treasures (Cost: 50 Bonus Time)
Extra Rarity Chance (Cost: 50 Bonus Time)

Specialties:
Each +1 in a specialty allows time to accrue 10% faster per point.
There are other bonuses which stack additively with area specialties.
Each Pet Friend / Adventure Pal you have access to gives +5% time accumulation.
Your chosen Hero Pet also gives +10% speed per level, the total of which is doubled on their listed ability.
Hero Pets start at level 1.

Known Account/Hero Pets & Specialties:
Ninja Kitty: Flops
Ninja Tortise: Stealth
Honey Badger: Strongness
Ninja Squirrel: Sniffing
Fanboy Sidekick: Nomming
COURAGE WOLF: Bopping
Blazing Phoenix: Speedy
1.1 Tailed Fox: Eleven
Gamble Fish: Shenanigans
IT IS NOT YET KNOWN IF PET LEVELS OUTSIDE OF PETVENTURES HAS AN EFFECT ON THESE BONUSES

Training Area: Ramen Shop
Takes 40 minutes to complete.
Specialty: Sniffing

Training Area: Training Grounds
Takes 60 minutes to complete.
Specialty: Bopping

Training Area: Genin Schoolyard
Takes 120 minutes to complete.
Specialty: Fancy

Training Area: Storage Room
Takes 120 minutes to complete.
Specialty: Flops

Purchasable Adventure Pals (known as Pet Friends):
Socks (Bopping +1, Flops +2, Nomming +2: 100 min)
Tabby (Shenanigans +2, Speedy +2, Bopping +1: 150 min)
Roy (Fancy +3, Flops +2: 500 min)
Erwin (Flops +2, Nomming +3: 600 min)
Nuisance (Shenanigans +2, Stealth +3: 700 min)
Suki (Stealth +3, Speedy +2: 800 min)
Cleo (Stealth +3, Speedy +2: 800 min)
Heru Ryu (Stealth +3, Speedy +2: 800 min)

Item Tiers:
Regular/Orange: exactly what is says on the tin.
Rare?/Grey: Rarer than Orange, but don't require specific skills/friends to find.
Gold-Level/Yellow: These drops require a certain skill (or set of skills) to be found. If your pet doesn't have the skill required, the item is impossible to find. If your pet does have the skill required, it's assumed that this item is as hard to find as a rare item.
Amazing-Level/Blue: These items require a specific friend to be present in order to find said drop. So far it appears that each area has one Amazing-Level drop.

Finding Lost (Found!) Cat Poster granted me the Adventure Pal Ridley

Treasures list:
- Ramen Shop
Regular/Orange: Empty Bowl - Used Chopsticks - Balled-Up Napkin - Old Receipt - ??? - Lost (Found!) Cat Poster
Rare?/Grey: ??? - ??? - Long Spoon
Gold-Level/Yellow: ??? - Fresh Pickle - ??? - ???
Amazing-Level/Blue: ???
- Training Grounds
Regular/Orange: Chewed Kunai - Dud Smokebomb - Training Helmet - ??? - Jump Rope - Crumpled Soda Can
Rare?/Grey: ??? - ??? - ???
Gold-Level/Yellow: ??? - ???
Amazing-Level/Blue: ???
- Genin Schoolyard
Regular/Orange: ??? - ??? - ??? - Used Eraser - ???
Rare?/Grey: ??? - ??? - ???
Gold-Level/Yellow: ??? - ??? - Love Letter
Amazing-Level/Blue: ???
- Storage Room
Regular/Orange: Deflated Ball - ??? - ??? - First-Aid Kit - ???
Rare?/Grey: ??? - ??? - ???
Gold-Level/Yellow: ??? - ???
Amazing-Level/Blue: ???

Next Unlock: 50% or more complete in Village (Coming tonight, sorry i have to be at the store all day) [ed note: unknown if Village refers to Training Area specifically]

Known Treasures:
Dud Smokebomb (+2 Min)

item.title: Petventures: Created Page
item.content:encoded: I don't have much of an idea about what I'm doing with wiki's, so I'll just throw information here and let you guys figure it out, I guess.

item.title: Flux Capacitor:
item.content:encoded: I just looked at RoboFighto, and there's an effect called Charged that's not actually on any known part. Is it possible that a Charged Flux Capacitor is supposed to be a usable robopart separate from a standard flux?

item.title: Syntherum:
item.content:encoded: Will also grant Long Day Ahead 1-point trophy if you don't already have it.

item.title: Div-R-Eon:
item.content:encoded: The original Div-R-Eon kaiju did not spawn additional clones, this was part of the original scavenger hunt kaiju request, but wasn't added for years afterwards. I am however happy it was eventually added.

item.title: The Tool and the Talent:
item.content:encoded: Of course, the two and e.g. Emosuke Lvl. 3 will be a better team than itself, going by the comment on "high range", while preserving (read: upping) the strength bonus. I'd recommend Bones Lvl. 2 myself, if range is needed and strength not as important, to get rid of village HP boni. If you're far enough along in content, though, Euthanasia is a solid alternative - at that point, your allies would cause an additional 40 damage per round. Also, at that point, you probably don't need the range as badly anymore.

item.title: R00t Guide:
item.content:encoded: The page says to go to the Phase menu to do field actions, but as far as i can see, the only thing on Phase menu is phase-kaiju.

item.title: Land a Whale:
item.content:encoded: It might be, that you need to have the action Boot enabled to be able to find a whale.

item.title: In Kaiju It Means Love: List of weirdness at 111 complexity with only one ally face
item.content:encoded:
feathers on the sides
the logo of the local ramen stand
an unstable sigil! -1/+1 Edge randomly!
a wicked flaming skull in the shape of a pizza slice
'tattoo'. Like, the word tattoo. huh
an anchor. nice
a picture frame around the original work
a fancy mustache
a wicked flaming pizza slice in the shape of a skull
a unicorn jumping over a rainbow
C-A-T-S R-U-L-E around the outside
a cute little flower that looks like.. it's barfing?
eyepatches on everything
one tiny taco for every taco you've ever had

item.title: Sacred Hang:
item.content:encoded: Brilliant delicious paradise is the field this trophy is on, when you first visit the field text says you almost trip over a trophy
